skill.name: code-to-music
skill.description: Tools, patterns, and utilities for creating music with code. Output as a .mp3 file with realistic instrument sounds. Write custom compositions to bring creativity to life through music. This skill should be used whenever the user asks for music to be created. Never use this skill for replicating songs, beats, riffs, or other sensitive works. The skill is not suitable for vocal/lyrical music, audio mixing/mastering (reverb, EQ, compression), real-time MIDI playback, or professional studio recording quality.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate music generation skill. It uses standard music libraries (music21, mido, FluidSynth, pydub) to compose and render music. No network calls, no credential access, no obfuscation. Low risk from filesystem access for music files and standard package installation.

content.value_statement: Turn creative ideas into original music compositions. Generate algorithmic melodies, chords, and rhythms programmatically. Export finished pieces as MP3 files with realistic instrument sounds.
actual_capabilities: Compose music programmatically using music21 library
Set MIDI instruments and velocities using mido
Render MIDI to audio using FluidSynth with soundfonts
Convert audio to MP3 format with pydub
Validate audio quality and detect issues
Extract and modify MIDI structures from existing files
limitations: Instrumental music only - no vocals or lyrics
MIDI-based synthesis - not studio recording quality
No real-time playback - files render before listening

use_cases.title: Original background music
use_cases.description: Generate unique instrumental tracks for videos, games, or presentations without copyright concerns.

use_cases.title: Learn music theory
use_cases.description: Explore chord progressions, scales, and arrangements through code-based composition experiments.

use_cases.title: Audio in applications
use_cases.description: Add procedurally generated music to apps, games, or creative projects through code.

prompt_templates.title: Simple melody
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple piano melody in C major at 120 BPM. Export as my_melody.mp3.

prompt_templates.title: With chords
prompt_templates.prompt: Compose a jazz piece with piano, bass, and drums. Use ii-V-I chord progression. Export as jazz_piece.mp3.

prompt_templates.title: Full arrangement
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an orchestral piece with strings, brass, and woodwinds. Include a crescendo in the middle section. Export as orchestral.mp3.

prompt_templates.title: Custom structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Render this music structure to MP3: read structure.json and create output.mp3 with the specified instruments and notes.

output_examples.input: Create a relaxing ambient piece with pads and soft textures
output: An MP3 file with atmospheric synthesizer pads
Layered chord textures in the background
Soft attack and long sustain on all notes
No drums - peaceful and spacious arrangement

best_practices: Use music theory - real chord progressions and proper voice leading create better compositions
Set appropriate velocities - lead instruments 90-105, background 50-65, drums 70-90
Choose the right pipeline - traditional for orchestral/acoustic, electronic for synth-based music
anti_patterns: Hardcoding melodies - generate notes algorithmically for variety
Using default velocity 64 - instruments will sound flat and lifeless
Forgetting mido program numbers - tracks will default to piano sound

faq.question: What AI tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Use Claude for creative composition and complex music theory.

faq.question: How long does rendering take?
faq.answer: Most pieces render in 5-30 seconds. Complex arrangements with many instruments may take longer.

faq.question: Can I use my own soundfonts?
faq.answer: Yes. Point to your custom .sf2 file when initializing FluidSynth. FluidR3_GM is the default.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: All processing is local. No audio data is sent anywhere. Files are created only in locations you specify.

faq.question: Why does my MIDI sound like piano?
faq.answer: Music21 instrument classes do not set MIDI program numbers. You must use mido to insert program_change messages.

faq.question: How is this different from text-to-music AI?
faq.answer: This skill generates music through code - you control every note, instrument, and timing. Text-to-music AI creates audio directly from descriptions.
